text: was a Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Ide was born in Shizuoka on November 27, 1908. He played Tokyo OB Club. He won 1933 Emperor's Cup with Shiro Teshima and Teiichi Matsumaru at the club. In May 1930, when Ide was a Waseda University student, he was selected the Japan national team for Far Eastern Championship Games in Tokyo and Japan won the championship. At this competition, on May 25, he debuted against Philippines. Ide died on August 17, 1998 at the age of 89. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1930||1||0 |- !Total||1||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1908 births Category:1998 deaths Category:Footballers from Shizuoka Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers
title: Tameo Ide
